sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 36 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C36, the alternating group A4 × C3, or one of the nine non-abelian groups of order 36.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 36 exist? List all the groups along with their corresponding isomorphism classes.
message_2:
There are four non-isomorphic groups of order 36. These groups are:

1. Cyclic group: C_36
This group has one generator, and it is isomorphic to the additive group of integers modulo 36 (Z_36).

2. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_9 × C_4
This group is formed by taking the direct product of a cyclic group of order 9 and a cyclic group of order 4. It has two generators, one for each cyclic group.

3. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_3 × C_12
This group is formed by taking the direct product of a cyclic group of order 3 and a cyclic group of order 12. It has two generators, one for each cyclic group.

4. Semidirect product of C_9 and C_4: C_9 ⋊ C_4
This group is a semidirect product of a cyclic group of order 9 and a cyclic group of order 4. It has a more complex structure than the direct product groups.

To summarize, the four non-isomorphic groups of order 36 are:

1. C_36
2. C_9 × C_4
3. C_3 × C_12
4. C_9 ⋊ C_4
